div1.head: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Henry Hanson, July 28, 1928

opener.dateline:
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
July 28, 1928.

div1.p:
I have been hoping to hear good news of, and from, you for a
long time, but your letter, written before Xmas last year, is my last
news. I had flu in November, a relapse in December, was in the Hopkins
under Thayer in February and March and am still running a rapid pulse
and have little resistence to anything that comes along, despite which
fact I've been working here in Washington all summer (checking the ref-
erences in Father's book) from seven to ten hours a day. And hot!--I
never felt anything like it in the American Tropics.

Re bibliography, I'd be ever so grateful if you would tell me
the names and dates of the publications in which to find the articles
by yourself, referred to by Father in his book:--i.e.
P. 8. Hanson, Henry (19 )? Re aegypti not breeding in collections
of water with exclusively "earth" (mud)
"sides" etc.
P. 10. Hanson, Henry (1922) Re lower limit aegypti feeding (Lima)?
Peru--17 C. (62.6 F) in nature.
..."active and feeding in the evenings." (Of course
I can get the exact pagination for the above quotation
when I get the medical journal in which it appears. I'm
working at the Library of the Surgeon General of the
Army at present, where everyone is most kind and helpful.
P.29. Hanson, Henry (1922) Found aegypti on West Coast South America, a
Ica (about 14 South)
Also I wonder if you can tell me in which one of his many writings Sir
Rubert Boyce reports an aegypti imago remaining infective for three months
and
Which publication of the Pasteur Commission reports a single case of trans-
mission of infection to progeny of mosquito? ok-I have this

If you can't send me A. & B with the data for your own bibliography
which I should like to have as soon as possible, don't hold up your own
the latter in the hope of finding the former, but sent it to me a little
later, if you can. We are pressing the work for all we are worth and I
I
-2-
want to take the verified references back to Frost, in Baltimore, as
soon as ever I can. He is to do the final editing of the book.

I'm writing this in trip[unclear]licate, as I have no idea where you are
and shall try your former address in Iowa first and then start on the
carbons, if I don't hear from you within a reasonable time. I do hope
that I will hear, however.
With love to the children and all manner of good wishes to yourself,
